meanings.definition: A person who spreads grit or salt on roads to prevent ice.
meanings.sent1: The gritter drove the truck and spread salt on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: The city hired a gritter to keep the roads safe during winter.
meanings.sent3: The gritter slipped on the ice while spreading salt, but managed to stay upright.
meanings.sent4: The gritter's dedication to keeping the roads safe was as solid as the salt they spread.
meanings.sent5: Children waved at the gritter as it passed by, grateful for the clear roads.

meanings.definition: A machine used to spread grit or salt on roads.
meanings.sent1: The gritter was parked in the garage, ready to be used when snow fell.
meanings.sent2: The city invested in a new gritter to improve road maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The gritter hummed to life as it began spreading salt on the icy streets.
meanings.sent4: The gritter's mechanical arms moved gracefully, scattering salt in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow color of the gritter made it easily visible in the snowstorm.

meanings.definition: To spread grit or salt on roads to prevent ice.
meanings.sent1: I will gritter the roads early in the morning before the traffic starts.
meanings.sent2: The city workers gritter the streets before the snowstorm hit.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, someone decided to gritter the driveway with sugar instead of salt.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to gritter every corner of the road showed her commitment to safety.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gritter in action echoed through the silent night, a beacon of precaution.
